fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Monomorphisms can be expressed using finite limits

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Given a morphism f : X \to Y in an arbitrary category, we can express the condition of being monic using finite limits.
We claim that f being monic is equivalent to the following square being a pullback square:

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-preamble: \usepackage{mlmodern, tikz, tikz-cd, quiver, mathtools, amssymb, stmaryrd, mathrsfs}
fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \begin {tikzcd} X & X \\ X & Y \arrow ["f"', from=2-1, to=2-2] \arrow ["f", from=1-2, to=2-2] \arrow [" \operatorname {id} "', from=1-1, to=2-1] \arrow [" \operatorname {id} ", from=1-1, to=1-2] \arrow [" \lrcorner "{anchor=center, pos=0.125}, draw=none, from=1-1, to=2-2] \end {tikzcd}

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: For the forward implication, we consider the diagram

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-preamble: \usepackage{mlmodern, tikz, tikz-cd, quiver, mathtools, amssymb, stmaryrd, mathrsfs}
fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \begin {tikzcd} Z \\ & X & X \\ & X & Y \arrow ["f"', from=3-2, to=3-3] \arrow ["f", from=2-3, to=3-3] \arrow [" \operatorname {id} "', from=2-2, to=3-2] \arrow [" \operatorname {id} ", from=2-2, to=2-3] \arrow [" \lrcorner "{anchor=center, pos=0.125}, draw=none, from=2-2, to=3-3] \arrow [dashed, from=1-1, to=2-2] \arrow ["g"', curve={height=6pt}, from=1-1, to=3-2] \arrow ["h", curve={height=-6pt}, from=1-1, to=2-3] \end {tikzcd}

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Since f is mono, this diagram commutes iff g = h, in which case there is a unique way to fill in the dashed arrow, which is g.

On the other hand, if the diagram is a pullback, then for every pair of morphisms g, h : Z \rightrightarrows X, we can draw the diagram above, and obtain the dashed arrow k : Z \to X. The diagram commuting implies g = \operatorname {id} \circ k = h.
